meanings.definition: Capable of being brought forward as evidence or argument.
meanings.sent1: The adducible facts supported his case in court.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer presented adducible evidence to prove her point.
meanings.sent3: It was quite adducible that the cat had stolen the cookies.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an adducible sign of her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The adducible documents were crucial for the investigation.

meanings.definition: Able to be cited or referenced.
meanings.sent1: The adducible sources confirmed the historical event.
meanings.sent2: Students should always use adducible references in their essays.
meanings.sent3: The adducible book was so popular that it sold out.
meanings.sent4: His words were as adducible as a well-known quote.
meanings.sent5: The adducible data supported the scientist's theory.

meanings.definition: Suitable for use as proof or support.
meanings.sent1: The adducible arguments strengthened her position.
meanings.sent2: The adducible facts were crucial in making the decision.
meanings.sent3: It was adducible that the cake was delicious by the empty plate.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication was adducible in the success of the project.
meanings.sent5: The adducible testimony convinced the jury of his innocence.
